# vmnet_network_copy_serialization(_:_:) | Apple Developer Documentation

- [ vmnet ](/documentation/vmnet)

- [ vmnet_network_copy_serialization(_:_:) ](/documentation/vmnet/vmnet_network_copy_serialization(_:_:))

-  vmnet_network_copy_serialization(_:_:) 

Function# vmnet_network_copy_serialization(_:_:)

Mac Catalyst 13.0+macOS 26.0+

```
func vmnet_network_copy_serialization(
    _ network: vmnet_network_ref,
    _ status: UnsafeMutablePointer<vmnet_return_t>?
) -> xpc_object_t?
```

## [ Parameters ](/documentation/vmnet/vmnet_network_copy_serialization(_:_:)#parameters)

`network`The network object to be copy serialized.

`status`Optional output parameter, returns status.

## [Return Value](/documentation/vmnet/vmnet_network_copy_serialization(_:_:)#return-value)

Serialized copy of network in `xpc_object_t`, NULL otherwise. Optionally, `status` will contain the error code.

## [Discussion](/documentation/vmnet/vmnet_network_copy_serialization(_:_:)#discussion)

Copy serializes a vmnet network to an xpc object. Use `vmnet_network_create_with_serialization` to create a new network object from such xpc object.
